children.subject: Not sure if this is helpful, but I declared CS last spring (spring 2020), and registered for CS 61C and CS 170 in phase 1 (for Fall 2020). I got into 61C directly, and was put on the 170 waitlist until my major declaration came through sometime in the summer and was then directly enrolled in 170.

history.content:
I am a prospective CS major planning to take CS 61C and CS 170 this semester. I had taken CS 61B in Fall '20 and CS 61A and CS 70 in 2019-20. I am already declared as an Applied Math major though, so I would need to apply for a double major.

I am concerned about the enrollment policies for 61C and 170. How likely are my chances if I waitlist in Phase 1, then declare my major and hopefully get off the waitlist during Phase 2? I realize most seats are reserved for CS majors and I am a little late in declaring my major, but I'd like to know how realistic my chances are for getting into both classes.
history.subject: CS 61C, CS 170 and Major Declaration
